name: Enable encryption at rest for DocumentDB clusters using AWS KMS Customer Managed Keys (CMK)
description: Ensure that all DocumentDB clusters have encryption at rest enabled using AWS Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Managed Keys (CMK). This provides an additional layer of data protection for your stored data.

name: Enable automatic backups for DocumentDB clusters with adequate retention period
description: Configure automatic backups for all DocumentDB clusters with a retention period of at least 7 days. This ensures that you can recover your data in case of accidental deletion or corruption.

name: Disable public access for DocumentDB manual cluster snapshots
description: Ensure that all manual snapshots of DocumentDB clusters are not publicly accessible. This prevents unauthorized access to potentially sensitive data stored in these snapshots.

name: Enable log export feature for DocumentDB clusters
description: Configure the log export feature for all DocumentDB clusters to send audit logs, profiler logs, and slow query logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. This enables better monitoring and analysis of database activities.

name: Enable deletion protection for DocumentDB clusters
description: Activate deletion protection for all DocumentDB clusters to prevent accidental deletion of the database. This adds an additional safeguard against data loss.

name: Enable audit logging for DocumentDB clusters
description: Activate audit logging for all DocumentDB clusters to track and record database activities. This helps in monitoring user actions, detecting suspicious activities, and maintaining compliance requirements.

name: Enforce TLS connections for DocumentDB clusters
description: Ensure that Transport Layer Security (TLS) is enforced for all connections to DocumentDB clusters. This secures data in transit between the client and the database instance.

name: Enable encryption at rest for DocumentDB global clusters
description: Ensure that all DocumentDB global clusters have encryption at rest enabled using AWS Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Managed Keys (CMK). This provides an additional layer of data protection for your globally distributed data.

name: Implement least privilege access for DocumentDB clusters
description: Ensure that IAM policies and DocumentDB cluster policies follow the principle of least privilege, granting only the necessary permissions to authorized entities. This minimizes the potential impact of compromised credentials.

name: Enable enhanced monitoring for DocumentDB clusters
description: Activate enhanced monitoring for all DocumentDB clusters to collect detailed metrics at the operating system level. This provides deeper insights into the performance and health of your database instances.

name: Use latest TLS version for DocumentDB connections
description: Ensure that the latest supported TLS version is used for all connections to DocumentDB clusters. This provides the most up-to-date security for data in transit.

name: Implement secure password policies for DocumentDB users
description: Enforce strong password policies for all DocumentDB users, including minimum length, complexity requirements, and regular password rotation. This helps protect against unauthorized access through weak or compromised credentials.

name: Restrict network access to DocumentDB clusters
description: Configure security groups and network ACLs to restrict network access to DocumentDB clusters. Allow connections only from necessary and approved IP ranges or VPC resources.

name: Enable automatic minor version upgrades for DocumentDB clusters
description: Configure automatic minor version upgrades for all DocumentDB clusters to ensure they receive the latest security patches and bug fixes automatically.

name: Implement regular patching schedule for DocumentDB clusters
description: Establish and follow a regular patching schedule for DocumentDB clusters to apply the latest security updates and patches. This helps maintain the overall security posture of your database instances.
